job_title: Head of Machine Learning - Retail Forecasting
job_Description: Our Opportunity:  If you are a data driven leader looking to solve complex supply chain problems and drive innovation in e-commerce, come join us!   Chewy  is looking for a  Head of Retail Forecasting  to join our Supply Chain Team based in Dania Beach, FL or Seattle, WA.   We are seeking a senior biz-tech leader who is highly motivated, goal-oriented, and an analytical hands-on leader who excels in a fast-paced environment. This leader will build, manage, and develop a high-performing team of Machine Learning Scientists, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product Managers. As single threaded owner, you will have end to end responsibility of the science and systems to create an industry leading forecasting function for Chewy’s retail business.   A successful leader will drive improvements in domestic supply chain, improve inventory availability and inventory health, own end to end forecast from planning to execution, define the forecasting and planning cycles, and more. You will develop machine learning and statistical models and processes to improve forecast accuracy and bias, improve understanding of forecasting casuals, and identify useful clusters and patterns in product type, seasonality, and region to provide a single source of truth for planning and execution teams. You will also drive production implementation of these critical systems to ensure continuous scalability.   This leader must have strong communication and partnership skills as it requires working closely with cross-functional leaders in Merchandising, Finance, Operations, and Transportation. In this role you will have a large impact on company financials and be responsible for working cross functionally throughout other teams planning cycles to provide an accurate forecast at the appropriate level. You will be responsible for building a strategy and then designing and implementing solutions and technologies which will handle the growing business needs and play a key role in redefining what it means to be a world-class Science and Supply Chain organization.  What you'll do:   Develop long term strategy for scaling the forecast planning, processes, and systems to support the retail business growth and vision.  Develop and operationalize machine learning and science-based tools/models iteratively to support growing business use cases and complexity.  Develop and deliver on key performance indicators for financial impact, forecast performance, plan accuracy, and more.  Develop tactical forecasts to support the business and financial plans.  Hire, develop, and lead a team of people leaders, machine learning scientists, data scientists, data engineers, and product managers.  Lead the team in model and algorithm development by taking business requirements and complex problem statements, and clearly defining data science/statistical projects.  Engage and drive industry leading engineering practices to drive efficient and scalable technical solutions.  Strong communication skills and clear articulation of the vision and implementation plans.  Drive Operation and Technical Excellence delivering highly scalable plans and systems.  Work with Supply Chain leadership to build a roadmap and clearly defined vision for the team.  Identify and manage priorities within the context of overall Chewy objectives   What you'll need:   15+ years in forecasting, machine learning, data science, and/or engineering positions in top CPG, retail, or e-commerce organizations  7+ years’ experience managing people and leading a team of leaders  An advanced degree (M.S., Ph.D., or equivalent experience) in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field  Proven experience with bringing structured thinking in ambiguous problems spaces and delivering solutions.  Experience with machine learning and advanced forecasting methodologies  Experience leading, coaching, and developing a high performing team  Position may require travel Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.   If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com   To access Chewy’s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here:  https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy ).

Our Opportunity:  Chewy is seeking a bright and curious  Senior   Data Analyst  to leverage a wide set of analytical skills to help us advance our Healthcare business at our headquarters in Dania Beach, FL. You will have the opportunity to dive in and investigate strategic business problems as we grow, scale and enter new markets.  What you'll do:   Partner with cross functional teams (product management, engineering, and business operations) to understand the insights they need to manage and grow their businesses  Develop, maintain, and enhance analytics solutions to provide business insights that guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities  Perform investigations into data questions and weaving those findings into an effective story to be actionable for business users  Maintain the quality and completeness of data in data warehouse for Healthcare business vertical by working closely with business and Data Warehouse teams  Proactively monitor customer behavior to identify trends that are sources of opportunity or potential issues, determine root causes, and work with business partners on next steps.     What you'll need:   A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, MIS, Engineering or related quantitative discipline with at least 1 year of related, full-time experience in an analyst role working on a business team or a Master’s degree in Information Systems, or quantitative field  Strong SQL skills with a working understanding of databases, ETL process, Data Modeling on unstructured or undefined data sets across multiple business functions.  An ability to develop production level code that can be implemented at an org level  Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Knime, OBIEE, Qlik, etc.)  Experience interpreting data, designing metrics and analyzing results using exploratory as well as statistical techniques  Experience presenting findings to business partners across the organization, including executive leadership  Excellent technical skills and a strong passion for data analysis and investigation and should also be intellectually curious in the quest for answers to the cause and effect of business outcomes.  A self-starter mentality and ability to operate within a fast-paced and ambiguous environment  Proven analytic skills using SAS, R or Python.  A foundational understanding of statistical techniques such as regression, predictive modeling, forecasting, time series analysis, and clustering and apply those to answer business needs   Bonus:   Experience using Vertica, Snowflake SQL, Google analytics, BigQuery, Click stream data, Data modelling, data warehouse, ETL process  Previous experience with ecommerce retail or similar setting or exposure to Sales/financial reporting  Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.   If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com   To access Chewy’s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here:  https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy ).

job_title: Artificial Intelligence, Consultant - Applied Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: Work you'll do  AI Consultants will Architect, Position, Design, Develop and Deploy enterprise solutions which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning, and Cognitive Services (e.g. Vision/Image, Textual/Language processing).  Perform data studies and data discovery routines for video, voice, weblog, sensor, machine and social media data sources or mash ups of new and existing data sources.     The team Analytics & Cognitive In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.  The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:  Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms  Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions  Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements     Qualifications:   2+ years of relevant Analytics consulting or industry experience  At least 6 months experience working with SparkCognition, Expert System, Microsoft Cognitive Services, IBM Watson, Numenta, Deepmind, CognitiveScale, CustomerMatrix, IPSoft, Pega, Salesforce Einstein, Google Cloud Platform/Tensor Flow, or Amazon Web Services/Sagemaker, and common open source scripting languages  At least 6 months experience working with Amazon Lex or IPSoft Amelia  Demonstrated expertise with one full life cycle analytics engagement across strategy, design and implementation.  Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Empirical Statistics or 4 years equivalent professional experience  Travel up to 50% (Monday - Thursday/Friday) (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)  Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.     Preferred:   Experience designing and implementing Apache Open Source (Kafka, Storm, Spark) Frameworks to process end to end data management life cycle for NLP, Machine Log Algorithms, Text Mining algorithms.  Java Programming at User Interface (UI) level  Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.  Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).  Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.  An advanced degree in the area of specialization   ANCCON  A&C_Consulting21

job_title: Lead Data Scientist - Total Audience Measurement
job_Description: Lead Data Scientist - Total Audience Measurement - 88784 Data Science - USA Oldsmar, Florida Data Science is core to what Nielsen does, and our research projects have high visibility in directly affecting the results of our business and our clients. As a senior data scientist, you will be supporting cutting edge methodologies in the Digital Total Audience team and provides the opportunity to contribute to methodological innovation in the exciting and fast-changing world of digital media measurement.This is an ideal position to grow as a data engineer, contribute to innovative products, and develop subject-matter expertise in digital methodology and cross-platform audience measurement. The Digital Total Audience team within the Data Science Research and Development organization focuses on building innovative methodologies and supporting Nielsen’s highly successful products out in the marketplace for cross platform (TV and Digital) total audience deduplication. As part of this exciting team, this position will focus on building cutting edge deduplication methodologies and be responsible for the design and maintenance of the data flow processes . You will be responsible for owning data science methodologies end to end and will act as the go-to subject matter expert on the team for best practices and design implementation for our sophisticated and innovative methodologies. What will I do ? Create, maintain, and support robust methodology such as machine learning or other statistical methods. Deliver datasets to support production systems and supports implementation validations, upholding high standards and best practices. Lead pipeline prototyping as well as supporting pilot programs for R&D purposes. The primary areas include – but not limited to – data integration, automation, generalization, harmonization as well as working with different data sources. Work with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new total audience measurement methodologies. Assist in the design and testing of data collection methodologies for Nielsen total audience products. Provide research support for the identification and implementation of methods and best practices to improve methodology implementation. Is this for me? Must Have experience building ML Models into Production, as well as, scaling. 3+ years of experience in a data science or data engineering role Bachelors degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Social Science, Operation Research, or other hard sciences (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, Biology, Physics etc.) with outstanding analytical expertise and strong technical leadership Proficient in Python or other general purpose programming languages, or other statistical/data processing packages, or Airflow management tools Proficient in the PyData stack or other machine learning, statistics, and data processing packages Familiar with working in Unix-based and cloud environments. Expert in SQL and working relational database management systems (RDBMS) Familiar with data airflow, data aggregation techniques, automation or generalization Preferred Proficient in pyspark or other big data processing languages Advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Social Science, Operation Research, or other hard sciences (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, Biology, Physics etc.). Demonstrates experience in Nielsen methodologies, data collection, platforms, research processes and operations. Domain expert in at least one area: Demography, Sampling, Statistics Modeling, Research Practices, Data Integration and/or Digital/TV measurement techniques ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth. Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work! Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Job Type:  Regular Primary Location : Oldsmar,Florida Secondary Locations:  , , , Travel:  No

Overview: At Spirit Airlines, our mission is to deliver the best value in the sky and be the most successful airline on Earth! We are leaders in providing customizable travel options and make it possible for our Guests to venture further and discover more than ever before by serving destinations throughout the U.S., Latin America, and the Caribbean! Imagine making your mark on an organization introducing 100’s of new aircraft that will double our fleet! Fly With A Winner:  We are proud to be one of FORTUNE World’s Most Admired® Companies in 2021. Our constant growth and improvement mean boundless career opportunities. Team Members develop their careers rapidly while building key skills that drive long-term success. The Giving Spirit : We are committed to inspiring positive change in the cities where we work and live. That starts with giving back through Corporate Social Responsibility and The Spirit Airlines Charitable Foundation. Be Yourself : We want Team Members to feel empowered to bring their whole self to work and contribute to our success – that’s why we’re committed to building progress in the areas of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging. Our Spirit Family is strong, not despite our differences, but because of them. Travel The World : We offer competitive base salaries with robust health & welfare benefits, including travel & flight benefits for you and your family. Job Summary: The Director, Data Science and Machine Learning facilitates data-driven decisions throughout the company by designing automated deep-learning systems, building advanced predictive models, providing valuable strategic insights, architecting outcome-oriented data storage, and democratizing access to data science processes across the organization. This role will build a team of data scientists that use programming languages and statistical methods to provide prescriptive insight into business performance, and effectively communicates findings and strategic opportunities uncovered by the analysis. Operating as an internal consultant, this role regularly delivers innovative analysis and strategic recommendations to the highest levels of leadership in the company. Responsibilities: Leads process or decisions that impact the overall organization. Building a data science team that provides innovative and insightful analysis on issues affecting the airline by bringing together data from across the organization, utilizing advanced programming and statistical modeling techniques. Drives the adoption of predictive analytics across the business, in both automated decision-making conditions and in larger strategic decisions. Works on the end-to-end data science pipeline: from data collection and cleaning, to experimenting with predictive models, to deployment of the results. Assesses data needs for project-specific outcomes and builds frameworks for lasting data architecture to exist after project completion. Coordinates with our Business Intelligence team to deploy new architecture. Collaborates with Business Intelligence leadership to leverage existing data pipelines and models for analytics and to transform insights into applied models for optimal decision-making Designs machine learning models to automate a variety of operational conditions, and maintains these models through routine review. Develops scenario-based simulation models for understanding the impact of changes to business planning, including scheduling, overbooking, connection efficiency, fuel burn, crew allocation, and more. Works with stakeholders to understand real-world context and translates those learnings to data conditions and hypotheses. Stay up to date on the latest industry trends as they relate to technology, methods, strategy and data. May perform other responsibilities as assigned. Responsibilities and duties may change when circumstances dictate (e.g., emergencies change in workload, rush jobs or technical developments). Qualifications: Bachelors Degree Master's degree preferred (Quantitative – Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Math, Data, and or related field). 7-10 years of experience Demonstrated working knowledge of SQL, and an understanding of AZURE. Working knowledge of Python and R. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to translate broad strategies into specific objectives and action plans. Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving skills and exhibits comfort with ambiguity.  Possess strong presentation skills and expertise in designing effective charts, graphs, and visualizations. Able to distill complex ideas into easy-to-understand concepts for fellow Team Members to comprehend.  Have knowledge of latest technology trends, tools, and techniques.  Strong business acumen and application of data science and machine learning to business strategy.  Experience managing staff, including responsibility for project assignments and performance evaluation. Additional Competencies Able to strategize and conceptualize on the highest levels, teach Team Members the how and why of data science work, and directly help with the tactical and functional execution of day-to-day tasks. Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.  Views problem solving through the eyes of internal and external Guests; Aims to “WOW” stakeholders by exceeding expectations on service. Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics. Develops project plans; Coordinates projects; Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget; Manages project team activities.  Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.  Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.  Writes clearly and informatively; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information; Excellent communicator, Able to present at all levels. *Please be advised that you will be asked to complete a required assessment to be considered for this position. This assessment will be emailed to you after you apply. Please be sure to check your Spam folder and/or junk mail if you do not receive it. * We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits to our team members including medical, dental, STD, LTD, life insurance, 401(k), paid time off, travel benefits and much more. We strive to maintain a professional, yet friendly environment and promote professional and career development for our Team Members. EEOC Statement: Spirit Airlines is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

job_title: Data Scientist - Fort Myers, FL based - Relocation Assistance Provided!
job_Description: With approximately 1,300 boutiques and outlets throughout the U.S., as well as an online presence for each of our brands, it takes sophisticated technology, resources and infrastructure to ensure the continued success of our businesses. From finance and accounting to technology and merchandising careers, we have diverse opportunities available for talented professionals to join our team of nearly 16,000 associates who share our commitment to excellence.  POSITION OBJECTIVE: This position is responsible for planning and managing projects across all analytics areas – descriptive, predictive, prescriptive, and cognitive – as needed by the various business functions. It requires the application of consistent and rigorous statistical analysis, and the effective articulation of results to management and business analysts to support scientific decision-making.  FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using Big Data techniques. Conduct data mining using state-of-the-art methods to drive optimization and improvement of marketing techniques and business strategies. Work with peers to enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems. Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of performance. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Build closed-loop algorithms to power scaled personalization within the digital experience. Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. Work cross-functionally to gather insights which will improve marketing efforts. Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends and how to best leverage machine learning, neural networks and other avenues to harness the power of the organizations vast data. This position may be found in multiple departments. Some duties may vary from department to department.  COMPETENCIES : Culture Living the Chico's FAS Values and Guiding Principles by demonstrating Customer focus, instilling trust, driving engagement, and driving results. Decision Quality Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. Action Oriented Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Interpersonal Savvy Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people. Situational Adaptability Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. Company Background Healthmap Solutions (Healthmap) is an NCQA-accredited industry leading kidney population health management company. Healthmap uses big data resources, integrated advanced technology, clinical expertise, and complex care management to improve the lives of people living with kidney disease. Healthmap also helps healthcare providers and payers achieve the value-based results they need. Our company is a diverse and growing organization committed to our clients, the patients we support, and our employees. We are champions for better health, for those who need us most. Position Summary The Manager of Data Science will be responsible for supporting Healthmap’s sales, product, operational, and performance initiatives through data research, analytics, visualization, and modeling. This individual will develop benchmarks for Data Science individuals to ensure analyses are completed on time and accurately. Manager will be tasked with day-to-day concerns and require agility for quick and/or changing deadlines. Manager will review data findings and offer constructive criticism to guide individual employees towards success. This individual is responsible for motivating team members and dissolve barriers to advancement. The manager, like all Data Science teammates, is expected to have personal experience with data analytics. This individual is to have a thorough and current understanding of client data to successfully guide the team. Responsibilities Manages and motivates analysts towards strategic department goals Works with department director to properly implement strategic projects with employee skills and schedule Determines metrics to measure and evaluate individual and team performance Fosters an environment of intellectual curiosity and mentor analysts towards constant improvement Performs functions related to problem definition, data collection, interpretation and analysis, visualization, and presentation/communication of results and recommendations Maintains a working knowledge of healthcare coding and analytics techniques Manages personal and employee time appropriately to deliver results Identifies and reconciles roadblocks to success Ensures documentation of all processes, analyses, design, data definitions, and development Works with various cross-functional teams including sales, product development, clinical, and care services Discovers opportunities for team growth or change, and engages with department director to determine best course(s) of action Requires HIPAA understanding and complete confidentiality protocols: Associate must demonstrate understanding and sign confidentiality documents Employee is expected to comply with HIPAA privacy laws and all other federal, state, and local regulations Report suspected or detected security events via company provided communication channels Follow all company-defined operational policies and procedures Protect and maintain confidentiality of company and customer information, policies, and processes The responsibilities listed are a general overview; other responsibilities may be assigned Perform other related duties as assigned Requirements Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, economics, public health, healthcare management and policy, or similar background 3-5 years’ work experience in analytics, preferably health analytics Minimum 3 years’ experience with SQL 5+ years’ experience with statistical software such as SAS or R preferred Management of large-scale projects and team lead experience Per Healthmap’s HR Security Policy, this position is considered HY (high risk for PHI and may require additional training/screening) Skills Excellent problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, strong quantitative capabilities, team contributor Oral and written communication, often adapted to non-analytical audiences Self-starter mentality: ability to take an idea from research to presentation and implementation Good project management, time management and organizational skills Ability to motivate team members towards department and company goals An interest in and desire to learn about the constantly evolving population health industry

Our Opportunity:  At Chewy, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. Chewy is looking for an  Sr. Reporting and Data Analyst  to join our HR Analytics Team based in Dania Beach, FL. The role will support in uncovering data-driven metrics & insights to better attract, hire, engage, develop, and retain Chewy’s most important asset – our talent.  This role will play an important part in supporting Chewy’s people priorities in support of our largest team member population. You will partner with key stakeholders within HR (such as Recruiting, Learning & Development, Business Partners, Compensation) and outside HR (such as Fulfillment Center Operations, Finance, etc.) to act as a consultant in solving people data-related questions.   What you’ll do:   Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (Workday), time and attendance system (Kronos), listening mechanisms (Glint), exit interviews, and other sources.  Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns relative to recruitment and hiring practices, retention and turnover, engagement and sentiment analysis, and talent development and movement.  Enhance our capability to analyze and “make sense” of large data sets and translate into a visually appealing manner that tells a story and helps make better data driven decisions  Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics.  Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior leadership.  Develop epics and user stories which support and prioritize FC People Analytics initiatives.  Collaborate with members of HR to identify, standardize, and implement data & analytics solutions, including enhanced tools and process improvements  Work with IT partners to build and maintain the HR Datamart  Partner with the source system owners, and data management team to develop and implement Data Governance through partnering with key stakeholders  Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.  Performs other duties as assigned.     What you’ll need:   Proven ability to use data, analytics, and business knowledge to solve complex business problems  Ability to quickly learn the organization analytics needs and business hypothesis, translate these into consumable data and analytics models.  Proven track record of superior service delivery, analytical expertise within an HR Function and ability to “tell the story“ using data.  Advanced Excel skill, Tableau experience required and hands on experience with one or more BI platforms / visualization tools desired  SQL, R, Python, and related software experience a plus  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Understanding of HR practices.  Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.  Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.   If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com   To access Chewy’s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here:  https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy ).

Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.   If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.  Our Client  Our Client's mission is to drive adoption and understanding of the financial systems of the future. They are the platform for off-chain intelligence that drives on-chain efficiency in Decentralized Finance (DeFi). They work with protocols to manage risk, improve capital efficiency, and manage incentive spend. They also publish cutting-edge research and aim to take a leading role in defining market risk standards across the industry.   Our client is building infrastructure that allows us to simulate and stress-test blockchain protocols, contracts, and network interactions at scale over a wide range of market conditions. Their models ingest a wide range of on-chain and off-chain data, and are continuously calibrated to the current crypto market structure so that our recommendations are always up-to-date. These models and infrastructure power the platform that currently manages risk and optimizes incentives for over $40B in assets.   You will be working as part of an experienced team that has developed simulation software for many other industries, including high-frequency trading, autonomous vehicles and ride-sharing, and the natural sciences  Responsibilities:  Architecting, implementing, and stewarding end-to-end data infrastructure   Building agent-based simulations of smart contracts and blockchain networks using our Python SDK   Designing and optimizing incentive models for blockchain protocols and help discover potential attack vectors   Build data models and visualizations of public blockchain data and simulation results that provide intuitive analytics to customers   Understand product, risk, and business requirements and how to apply ML to solve our most challenging problems in impactful ways   Automating and scaling simulation model deployment on cloud infrastructure   Make business recommendations to the executive and cross-functional teams (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) effectively through findings from quantitative information   Driving best practices around security in data engineering   Driving data literacy and data-driven decision making across functions  Qualifications:  8-10 years of relevant experience   Experience developing production quality software in Python, Go, or other high-performance languages   Experience with scientific computing packages such as Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, etc..   Track record of designing, building, scaling and maintaining production services, and composing service-oriented architecture   Experience with distributed computation frameworks such as Spark, Flink, TensorFlow   M.S. or Ph.D. in STEM field, with experience building production Blockchain pipelines (development, deployment, inference and monitoring) at scale  Bonus Points:  Smart contract development experience (e.g. Solidity)   Experience with building Machine Learning infrastructure at scale

job_title: Data Scientist - Audience Measurement Custom Analytics
job_Description: Data Scientist - Audience Measurement Custom Analytics - 101421 Data Science - USA Tampa, Florida Nielsen is looking for a Data Scientist for the Audience Measurement Custom Analytics team. Custom Analytics is a new team within the larger Audience Measurement Product organization that is tasked with the assessment, solutioning, development and implementation of custom studies for clients. These deliverables typically include requests for data sets and features that are on the longer term roadmap for our core products, but not immediately available for client consumption. This includes custom deduplication of platforms that are not available in our standard product suite, the reporting of advanced audiences, and other similar requests.  As a Data Scientist you will: Utilize and develop innovative statistical modeling (and machine learning / deep learning methodologies where applicable) to enable custom audience analytics based on large volumes of data from various sources Assist in the decisions on the selection of methodologies, technical tools and processes that most effectively and efficiently reach the desired outcome Work within an Agile, cross-functional scrum team to develop, validate, and optimize methodologies Support deployment and maintenance of data pipelines and models Assist in the design and implementation strategies to automate data delivery using the methodologies developed Stay abreast of developments in quantitative research methodology and changing technologies in the marketplace and proactively identify applications of these latest developments to improve existing methods Summarize, document, and communicate research findings to audiences of varying levels of technical subject matter expertise  What will I do? Communicate key project data to team members and build team cohesion and effectiveness Execute against the team roadmap within your scrum team, which encompases all work (business, technical/operational, and methodological needs) Participate in agile ceremonies (Standups, Sprint Planning, Sprint Demos, Backlog Grooming, Retrospectives) Adhere to release governance practices and any required audit documentation Exhibit expertise in your product domain (understanding the systems involved, the technical component flow, specific aspects of the methodology, etc.) Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets   Is this for me? Bachelor's degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, social sciences, biological/physical sciences, computer science, or some other quantitative research field At least 2 years research experience in a business setting Outstanding statistical and analytical skills with experience in machine/ deep- learning techniques Proficiency in Python Experience with modern machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g. LightGBM, XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Stan, etc.) Experience with cloud environments and big data technologies (e.g., Spark, AWS) Collaborative code development experience, including version control, unit/integration testing, code review and sharing (preferably in Git)  PREFERRED Knowledge of Bayesian inference and probabilistic programming (e.g. Pyro) Knowledge of Natural Language Processing Skilled at feature engineering Subject matter intuition for the causal drivers of media consumption Knowledge of data visualization tools/packages Some experience working within Agile teams #LI-MJ1 ABOUT NIELSEN By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth. Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work! Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Job Type:  Regular Primary Location : Tampa,Florida Secondary Locations:  PA - Pittsburgh, IL - Chicago, , Travel:  No

ActiGraph is an international leader in the development of validated medical-grade wearable solutions used to measure physical activity, sleep, and behavior patterns in the broader global academic and pharma research communities. ActiGraph is looking for an experienced data scientist who is passionate about using data science to advance clinical research and improve health. The team you will join is responsible for developing and validating new digital clinical measures using time-series health data collected from smart sensing technology. In this role, you will build data processing pipelines, conduct data analytics and collaborate with clinical and movement scientists on the interpretation of the digital measures. We hope you'll consider j oining us in our mission to help bring digital data to life! The essential duties and responsibilities for this role include:  Providing data science expertise, in collaboration with clinical science, to identify relevant digital measures that advance ActiGraph’s products and vision in clinical research.  Building and maintaining the state-of-the-art technical capabilities to support the development and processing pipelines of digital measures from large-scale sensor data.  Designing, implementing and evaluating statistical approaches for health data analytics. Lead collaborations with 3rd party companies providing analytical support. Lead the SDLC process to ensure the robustness of analytics solutions.  Mentor junior colleagues on the data science team, helping establish DS role models and best practices.  Utilizes team collaboration to create innovative solutions efficiently.  All responsibilities are to be performed in accordance with the ActiGraph core values, standards, policies, and procedures. As an equal opportunity employer, all employment at ActiGraph is governed without regard to, nor influenced by, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Requirements The ideal candidate will have the following required qualifications:  PhD in mathematics, computer science, electrical engineer, physics, or related field with 3+ years of industry experience or MS in related field with 5-8 years industry experience  Experience with the analysis of time-series data from motion (e.g. IMU, Video) and physiological (e.g. ECG, EMG, EEG, HR, temperature, speech) capture devices  Strong background in data science, signal processing, and machine learning  Strong software development skills, with proficiency in Python  Experience in developing cloud-native solutions using services such as AWS or Azure  Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills to convey results with team members, colleagues, external experts, and regulatory authorities  Preferred qualification are:  Experience in the clinical trial, research, and/or healthcare industry Experience in the measure of gait, posture, range of motion using wearable or IoT devices.  Expertise in advanced machine learning techniques. Experience with SDLC especially in a regulated digital health environment is a plus  Experience working in a translational, collaborative, and multidisciplinary environment  Experience in building containerized data processing pipelines using Docker Benefits At ActiGraph, we do our best to offer benefits and a work environment that is positive, fun, and tailored towards the needs and feedback of our team members. We do so by offering:  A casual "dress-code" environment  Pet friendly offices  A family-oriented and collaborative workplace  Paid time off (including paid time off for your birthday)  And a very generous suite of benefits including: medical, dental, vision, basic/life accidental, short/long term disability, identity theft, 401K (plus a match), supplemental insurance options, AND tuition reimbursement

location: 6600 N Military Trl, Boca Raton, FL 33496
job_Description: Overview   Varis is a well-funded, highly disruptive, and fast-growing technology startup. Our incredible team includes top industry leaders with decades of experience. We are innovation driven, customer centric, and ready to transform eProcurement. Our culture is focused on bold vision, launching the most minimal valuable solution to learn, then either failing or scaling fast. We seek teammates who drive value creation, are great problem solvers, have strong interpersonal savvy, and can successfully learn on the fly! Varis is a bold new company that formed in early 2021. Joining us now is a ground-floor opportunity to shape our limitless future. We are looking for an experienced Business Analytics Sr. Manager to lead the Business Analytics team supporting Spend Analytics, Supplier Analytics and Product Management teams. The team is a collaborative group that enables our customers and products teams to make informed decisions. Our work is dedicated to empowering leaders and enabling action through data and science.  As a Business Analytics Sr. Manager, you will be responsible for leading a team that builds scalable analytical tools, deep business insights and predictive models that deliver on the ever-evolving analytical needs of the customers. You will work closely with business stakeholders, other Business Intelligence and Data Engineering Managers in planning, designing, executing and implementing the reporting ecosystem. Primary responsibilities will include managing a team of Business Intelligence Engineers, Data architects and Data Scientists, interviewing, training and building a strong team, ongoing development of standard operating procedures, and accountability for setting and meeting team goals.  Job responsibilities This role requires excellent technical skills in order to lead the development of scalable analytics, excellent written/verbal communication skills to interact effectively with business leadership, as well as, but not limited to, the ability to understand business context at its depth and translating it into analytical delivery specs.   You should be an experienced manager capable of leading and inspiring a team of excellent BI engineers and data scientists. You should be skilled at helping engineers navigate priorities and communicating clearly with customers. You should be knowledgeable in the architecture of reporting platforms (Tableau/Power BI), statistics fundamentals, data analysis and data warehouse solutions. You should be able to architect highly efficient data and reporting structures, making a trade-off between scalability, performance and user functionality needs. Above all you should be passionate about solving business challenges with data/analytics, drive adoption of analytics, and effect data driven decision-making.   BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in a technical or analytical field (computer science, economics, math, or statistics or related) 5+ years of professional experience with a heavy emphasis on data and analytics 2+ years of experience managing teams, including hiring, performance management, and coaching. Strong expertise in SQL PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of basic data visualization techniques (scatter plots, fit lines, bar charts, time series, etc.) Basic knowledge of a data science programming language (R Shiny and/or Python) Knowledge of basic statistical techniques for hypothesis testing or prediction (Correlation, Regression, Logistic Regression, ANOVA, Chi-square, Confidence Interval, etc.)

job_title: Business and Data Analyst, Senior Vice Present
job_Description: Advance Data Analytics and Services (ADA) Team is a group within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) Organization, responsible for developing libraries, models, and applications centered around the in-house big data platform. The team works closely with Risk technology and the RMA analytical model teams to leverage big-data modelling and solutions to complement the core modelling work. The team applies expertise across data management, cloud architecture and risk analytics to streamline the risk management processes. The initial scope of the work is on FRTB, providing tools and solutions to facilitate validation by model sponsors, reporting, understanding, and what-if analysis. The scope will then be extended across all product areas including RWA, CCAR, CECL/IFRS9. We are seeking a Business and Data Analyst at Senior VP level to lead the effort on: Leverages big data to develop innovative deployable solutions. Work closely with core infrastructure and model developers to design and develop visualization tools and analytical services Provide insights and supports to business users on the use of model and explains. Work closely with risk managers to translate business needs to technical specifications. Partners with Risk and Decision Management organizations to understand the source of new data and continue to improve the process of defining, extracting and utilizing the new data Communicate in a professional, effective and concise manner with high level executives and varied stakeholders. Provide leadership and guidance for junior modelers. In this role, the  Senior Data Analyst  is assigned to the Data Team within the Trulieve processing facility. The Senior Data Analyst will train and supervise Sampling Techs and Analysts, assigning special projects to facilitate method validation and development, writing new standard operating procedures and keeping them updated. They will be responsible for ensuring that products are sampled by third-party laboratories efficiently and in compliance with regulations.   Job Responsibilities:  (20%) Reviews the daily 3rd party laboratory sampling list and updates the Turnaround Report. Keeps track of the Not Sampled list.  (20%) Checks the team’s SAP entries and spreadsheets for accuracy regularly. Audits the SAP warehouses for anomalies.  (20%) Performs supervisory responsibilities including managing employees through Paychex, monthly and quarterly reviews, leadership assignments, and resolving technical issues. Reports disciplinary issues to the manager.  (10%) Writes, reviews, and updates standard operating procedures.  (10%) Mentors subordinates and keeps track of training progress.  (10%) Delegates special assignments to subordinates, ensuring timely and accurate completion.  (10%) Assists other departments and management with inquiries and requests for data and analysis. Required Education: The minimum qualifications for the position include supervisory experience and strong familiarity with SAP. The incumbent should possess the following KSA’s (knowledge, skills and abilities):  Knowledge of scientific principles, terminology and techniques related to cannabis processing and testing. Management experience is required.  Proficiency with Excel and other database software.  Knowledge of the policies and procedures which guide employees at Trulieve.  Ability to work independently and as a team leader, efficiently manage time, utilize problem solving skills and techniques, keep detailed and accurate records and maintain confidentiality concerning laboratory matters.  Ability to supervise, interact, and work cooperatively with staff. Other Requirements:  Florida Driver's License or ability to obtain one.  Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.  Must be able to pass a comprehensive background check. Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. The Data Team is active from 7am-10pm, seven days a week. This position will work at least 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency should arise. We are an EOE company.

The Parts House (TPH) is the fastest growing Direct-to-the-Installer parts supplier in Florida, Georgia, Alabama, and Puerto Rico. We carry 180,000 different part numbers covering 185 product lines from dozens of Manufactures. The Inventory Analyst will partner with the category manager teams to develop and execute inventory strategies that drive incremental sales and profit for XL Parts and The Parts House. He/she will be responsible for ensuring the attainment of DC order fill goals while maintaining inventory efficiency. The Inventory Analyst must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize in accordance with a rapidly changing environment. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Replenishment System Management Optimize the automated replenishment system parameters based on rate of sales, lead times and order frequency to ensure meeting our DC order fill goals and inventory levels to plan. Confirm replenishment strategies with supply chain management. Monitor product flow from domestic and import vendors to distribution centers and to stores; replenishing product as needed. Adhere to assigned category inventory budgets while achieving planned turnover and revenue growth Monitor vendor performance working to resolve issues that impact achievement of company goals Review the Unfulfilled report, the Vendor fill Rate and other related reports to monitor proper fill rates and communicate any issues to Merchandising and the vendor for appropriate action. Planning / Analysis Perform analysis and review upcoming promotional forecasts and seasonal activity based on sales, inventory and service level expectations. Actively supports the category business plan and line review process with data and analysis, providing recommendations and insights as necessary Analyze and review non-working inventory (NWI); create and monitor action plans to minimize inventory liability. Manage vendor returns to achieve non-working inventory goals and alignment with category plans. Assist in development of annual budget at category level to support company financial targets, including sales, receipts, inventory levels and future line reviews. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Minimum Requirements Demonstrated analytical ability and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail, planning, and organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong computer skills, systems aptitude, and experience Ability to work independently and with a high level of energy and initiative Ability to interface with all levels of management EDUCATION and /or EXPERIENCE Bachelor of Science degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Math or Statistics from an accredited four-year college or university or equivalent business experience. Advanced PC skills and Microsoft Office a must. Benefits:  We offer a variety of benefits including 401K, medical, dental, vision, life, and long-term disability insurance. We also offer PTO to all full-time employees. Note: A clean background check and drug screening are necessary for employment

We’re a family of health centers, supported by a family of Associates. For over 25 years, Health Choice Network (HCN) has been an employer of choice in South Florida, supporting health centers, patients, and the communities they serve. We are one of the first successful health center-controlled networks and our success is due largely to our Associates and their commitment to advancing our mission to improve the health status of our communities. Do you want to join an organization that believes in empowering their most precious resource, their Associates? Are you innovative and results driven? HCN is looking for talented, qualified individuals to join our rapidly expanding, first-class team. Position Summary This position is responsible for developing ongoing data specifications, running ongoing data needs, measurement analysis, monitoring and reporting of quality improvement initiatives. Position Responsibilities Serves as lead subject matter expert for all data needs for the Clinical Quality Department. Oversees successful validation and submission of all data requirements for clinical quality initiatives. Supports member health center service requests through Salesforce ticketing system by researching and providing solutions to data-related issues in Practice Analytics. Performs ongoing analysis of UDS, Meaningful Use, PCMH, HEDIS another clinical quality initiatives. Writes, develops, and publishes supplemental UDS reports to support health center reporting needs. Standardizes monitoring and trending of member center clinical quality performance metrics. Identifies areas of opportunity for network and member center performance improvement. Serves as lead subject matter expert in the mapping of clinical related data from HCN EMRs to data lakes. Works with internal and external stakeholders to ensure quality standards and data integrity is established and maintained amongst all HCN applications. Provides data build, specification write up, and reports for the following projects (but not limited to) NACHC Quality Improvement Projects Million Hearts Project ECHO FOCUS HRSA Other data-related cooperatives Manages departmental data request forms and backlog of data requests. Identifies areas of opportunity for network and member center performance improvement. Collaborates with internal teams on implementing optimal workflows and opportunities to improve performance and efficiency of systems. Actively consults on system upgrade testing and validation process. Serves as the network subject matter specialist on Practice Analytics, including application set up, end user training, report customization and support. Keeps abreast of technological system changes and innovations by maintaining a knowledge base consisting of release notes, system manuals & software enhancements. Performs ad hoc reports as needed. Other duties may be assigned. Skills, Abilities and Requirements Working proficiency in data management and reporting platforms. Ability to extract meaning and suggest action items from data, not just report metrics. Ability to articulate principles and concepts of data management and continuous quality improvement to technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to apply basic problem-solving skills. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment. Education, Experience and Certifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 3 years experience in healthcare with a demonstrated working knowledge of quality and data management. Expertise in research methodology, data analysis, database management and outcomes studies strongly preferred. Understanding of health care initiatives and health care data. Health Choice Network is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and complies with all federal and state laws, regulations and executive orders regarding affirmative action requirements in all programs. HCN is a drug-free workplace.

Proficient in Scripting languages; 3. Familiar with Windows Server and Linux; 4. Proficient in any of the following languages is a plus:  Java, C++, Scala, CUDA.

Zeta Global is a data driven marketing company focused on customer acquisition, retention, and growth. We are looking for a dynamic Senior Account Executive to sell data partnerships to join our team. The Sr AE, Data Partnerships will be responsible for identifying, contacting, pitching, and closing new data deals to expand our marketable universe of permissioned, first-party email data. This role includes managing the sales process from the first contact to the close and working closely with our data and email operations teams. The ideal candidate will have a proven record of meeting measurable sales goals as well as a full understanding of the entire sales cycle. Key Responsibilities Research new prospects and source new sales opportunities to build a pipeline of potential data clients Generate business opportunities through professional, strategic prospecting and networking Engage with executives at qualified companies to determine business synergies and scale Drive all aspects of the sales cycle from lead generation to closing Facilitate the onboarding and launch process after fully vetting opportunities Compile key data points and present viable opportunities to the business team to ensure a smooth and successful transition Achieve or exceed quarterly sales goals Required Qualifications and Experience 7-10 years of sales/business development experience with a minimum of 3-5 years of direct sales experience with email data Existing LinkedIn presence and experience required Strong written and verbal communication skills Detail-oriented and organized self-starter with a diligent work ethic Strong ability to work independently, effectively manage time, and consistently meet deadlines Excellent sales skills including the ability to create, maintain, and build relationships Positive, eager, enthusiastic, self-motivated, resourceful attitude Demonstrated track record of successfully meeting sales goals Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Zeta We are committed to building diverse teams with different identities, backgrounds and perspectives. We believe in providing a forum to connect at Zeta, to learn and celebrate differences. Our mission is to ensure we have an environment that enables a deep level of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work, and to increase both diversity at Zeta as well as in the technology industry. Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual ’ s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity or expression. #LI-MC1 About Zeta Global Zeta Global is a data-powered marketing technology company with a heritage of innovation and industry leadership. Founded in 2007 by entrepreneur David A. Steinberg and John Sculley, former CEO of Apple Inc and Pepsi-Cola, the Company combines the industry’s 3rd largest proprietary data set (2.4B+ identities) with Artificial Intelligence to unlock consumer intent, personalize experiences and help our clients drive business growth. Our technology runs on the Zeta Marketing Platform, which powers ‘end to end’ marketing programs for some of the world’s leading brands. With expertise encompassing all digital marketing channels – Email, Display, Social, Search and Mobile – Zeta orchestrates acquisition and engagement programs that deliver results that are scalable, repeatable and sustainable. Experience with analytic solutions applied to the Marketing or Risk needs of enterprises  Basic understanding of machine learning fundamentals.  Ability to take Machine Learning models and implement them as part of data pipeline  5+ years of IT platform implementation experience.  Experience with one or more relevant tools ( Flink, Spark, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Amazon Kinesis ). Current hands-on implementation experience required  At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects and engineers to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, Data and Analytics, HPC and more. In this role, you will work with our partners, customers and focus on our AWS Analytics and ML service offerings such Amazon Kinesis, AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, Amazon Athena, Amazon SageMaker and more. You will help our customers and partners to remove the constraints that prevent them from leveraging their data to develop business insights. AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. In our Global Specialist Practice, you will also have the opportunity to create white papers, writing blogs, build demos and other reusable collateral that can be used by our customers, and, most importantly, you will work closely with our Solution Architects, Data Scientists and Service Engineering teams. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with design, development and operations that leverages deep knowledge in the use of services like Amazon Kinesis, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Amazon Sagemaker, Amazon EMR, NoSQL technologies and other 3rd parties. Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions. You should be able to work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.   Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.  Hands on experience working on large-scale data science/data analytics projects.  Ability to lead effectively across organizations.  Hands-on experience with Data Analytics technologies such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Spark SQL, MLib or Storm/Samza.  Implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments.  Proficiency with at least one the languages such as C++, Java, Scala or Python.  Experience with at least one of the modern distributed Machine Learning and Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, MxNet Caffe, and Keras.  Experience building large-scale machine-learning infrastructure that have been successfully delivered to customers.  Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility trade-offs.  3+ years experiences developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.  Experience working on a code base with many contributors.  Ability to prototype and evaluate applications and interaction methodologies.  Experience with AWS technology stack.  Written and verbal technical communication skills with an ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.
